channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cars not seeing one way sign, 26th October
item.description:
Rosehill Street is one way but everyday cars and other vehicles go the wrong way. Can the signage be checked and possibly improved?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Rosehill Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple houses Rain water run off pipe blocked due to the stream drain exit point blocked, 26th October
item.description:
7 Chapel lane drain access overflowed due to high volume of rain during the recent storm causing damage to our drive way by lifting foundation of the drive displacing block paving. A Private drain company came to investigate blockage and identified that the exit point in the adjacent stream is blocked due stream sediment level covering the exit point.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chapel Lane, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: OPen trench across garden road liable to cause serious accident,, 26th October
item.description:
The whole width of Garden Road road was dug up today by BT. The open trench has been covered by a number of heavy yellow plates, but every time a vehicle goes over, the plates move. When I walked past a little while ago much of the trench was uncovered, creating a terrible hazard for vehicles, and especially cycles/motorcycles as there is no hazard lighting to give warning.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Garden Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping furniture, 26th October
item.description:
Someone has dumped a sofa in the middle of the grassy area of the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Coppice Gate, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights not allowing enough time for cyclists going uphill, 26th October
item.description:
The last 3 times (Oct 23rd, 24th, 25th) that I cycled through this section heading North I've gone through the lights either as they've turned green or very shortly after they turned green. Each time the other end had turned green before I passed it. This is extremely dangerous - I reported it on the 5th of October too - the timing on these lights is not safe and needs to be changed. None of the categories available to report this issue seem suitable, I'll just plump for one.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

item.title: Car parked over private entrance markings (H markings), 26th October
item.description:
As stated on GCC website ‘a private entrance H marking should not be used as reserved parking’ This vehicle is always on the road on the white markings. On a weekday morning the obstruction to the carriageway causes terrible queues all the way down Brookfield Road in both directions as vehicles struggle to pass freely. This is an ongoing issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish, 26th October
item.description:
A lot of rubbish dumped on the side of the river Chelt. Just on the west side of the bridge connecting Arle avenue and Colletts drive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Avenue, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin nearly full, 26th October
item.description:

item.title: Flytipping once again, 26th October
item.description:
As per usual somebody has decided to once again dump their household waste next to the green clothing bin. This happens all of the time and is about time the council took action to stop it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mendip Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several deep potholes outside Ragged Stone, old Reddings road, 26th October
item.description:
Also the road outside our driveway collects a very large pool of rainwater due to the road surface being badly dipped. This has been ongoing for several years which I thought the local councillors were dealing with?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Reddings Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 26th October
item.description:
Calling from Freshwater Property Management. Has received reports from tenants at property (Blacks Outdoor Ltd) of water ingress into the basement of the property from the public footway above. Have had an inspection by an engineer who stated that that this is the case, and currently have sandbags in place in an attempt to pause the problem. Asking if site inspection can be undertaken to solve the issue.
Report on FixMyStreet

light attached to corner of building is not working

item.title: Temporary traffic lights have been erected but there is no evidence of any work being done near Birch Drive. The disruption to people and business in the locality is significant.This is not acceptable., 26th October

item.title: Numerous pothole spreading across the width of the pavement, 26th October
item.description:
There are numerous potholes of various sizes spread across the pavement infront and to the side of the shop 'Cotswold Kitchen'. This is an area frequented by many old people and it is only a matter of time before someone trips on one of the holes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blacksmith Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
